page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Our area is covered by several large farms. The largest being{Willoughby {Farms.}Willoughby Farms, employs 28 men, 22 in arable, and 6 in dairy farming. They grow potatoes, sugar beat, wheat, peas, oil seed rape. The most important being wheat. All the farming is done by machinery, large tractors, plough, sow and harvest. Aeroplanes spray as well as tractors. Peaviners cut, gather and pod the peas. They are taken to be washed, chilled at the farm. Then sent to the factory.{Mr Middleton}is the dairy man. He milks{125}cows twice a day in a herring bone parlour. He gets up at 5.30 am and brings the cows from the field. He finishes work at 6.30 pm. In the winter the cows stay in the yard. He gets on an average{2400 litres of milk each day.
